csci331.team.red.dao

Class CharacterRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • csci331.team.red.dao.CharacterDAO
      • csci331.team.red.dao.CharacterRepository

  • public class CharacterRepository
extends CharacterDAO
    CSCI331T MW INTERFACE
    The CharacterRepository Class provides an interface for game play. It is the only class that other members use to interact with the current game play character database
    (Note that Oliver added a few methods in because at the last minute he realized they were needed)

    CSCI331T MW SUBCLASS
    The CharacterRepository Class extends from the CharacterDAO class as it uses the static global variables instantiated in CharacterDAO
    CharacterRepository takes the information generated by the dao and stores it in an in-game database
    Other sibling classes would also need to use the CharacterDAO class to talk to the database
    Author:
    melany

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()
        CSCI331T MW OVERRIDING

        Returns a random character and persists it in the game play character database.
        Overrides:
        getCharacter in class CharacterDAO
        Returns:
        Character

      • getCharacters

        public java.util.Set<Character> getCharacters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes)
        Iterates through the game-play characters looking for characters that match the pair supplied in the parameter. All matches are added to the return list of characters.

        If there are no characters in the game-play database that have the required parameters, new characters will be created that have the parameter, added to the character list AND to the game play database and returned.
        Parameters:
        attributes -
        Returns:
        Set of Characters, of size at least 10
